BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Who in their right mind would ever suspect that their headphones were spying on them?

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: individuals have a right to know and limit those who are collecting and utilizing personal information about them.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: the promise of ad tech - making your online ad dollar more productive - is actually wrong, and it makes it less productive.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: According to Dr. Fou, buying directly from quality publishers increases the productivity of display advertising by at least seven times and perhaps as much as 27 times compared to buying through a programmatic exchange.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: The key to better ad performance is to stay as far away as possible from questionable ad exchanges and the ad tech industry’s programmatic snake pit.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: So the question becomes, how can we encourage an acceptable version of online advertising that will allow us to enjoy the things we like about the web without the insufferable annoyance of the current online ad model?

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Like it or not, advertising funds just about everything on the web we like. Without advertising you’d be stuck with nothing but blogs and porn. And blogs are no fun at all.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: There is only one solution to the problem. Take away surveillance and online advertising will become a minor annoyance like all other advertising forms instead of an intolerable, disreputable scourge.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: in direct response the creative work never gets better. Never.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: It is beyond mind-blowing to think that there are about 1.2 billion websites in the world and 2 of them are raking in 77% of U.S. ad revenue.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: The US online ad industry grew 22% in 2016. But outside of the duopoly the growth rate was about 0.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: According to Pivotal Research Group, in the third quarter of 2016, 99% of all new online ad revenue went to Goobook.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: this coalition will deal with everything but the problem

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: While we welcome the willingness to tackle annoying ads, the CBA’s criteria do not address a key reason many of us install ad blockers: to protect ourselves against the non-consensual tracking and surveillance that permeates the advertising ecosystem operated by the members of the CBA.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: But surprise!…they’ll allow the ads they sell on their DoubleClick platform. So what we have here is Dracula guarding the blood bank.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Dr. Fou calculated that Fireball could generate 30 billion fraudulent ad impressions a minute. That’s not a typo — 30 billion a minute.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: “We serve ads to consumers through a non-transparent media supply chain with spotty compliance to common standards, unreliable measurement, hidden rebates and new inventions like bot and methbot fraud...”

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: at the end if the line, it looks like you are probably getting somewhere about 3¢ worth of actual ads seen by actual people for every dollar you spend on display advertising.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: for our advertising dollar we have probably gotten about 60¢ worth of fees and technology, 20¢ worth of viewability issues, 2¢ worth of additional fraud, and 18¢ worth of viewable real ads.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: The ad industry has never seen anything like the crookedness and sleaze of online advertising. And I have never seen anything like the willful ignorance and gullibility of today’s “marketing and advertising professionals.”

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: for two years Facebook had been reporting a grossly inflated measure of the time people spent watching videos on Facebook’s site –  inflating their numbers by as much as 80%.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Ad Age reported that the ANA’s ceo said the effort would go beyond rebates and include arbitrage of digital ad inventory. What arbitrage means is that agencies buy ad space at one price and then resell it to their clients at another price.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: YouTube took the hit because that’s where reporters went looking. But the problem is systemic.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: In ad fraud, all the advantage is to the offense – that is, the fraudsters.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: As a legitimate publisher you’re in a double bind. You want to move advertisers from the “generic eyeball” market to quality sites where site reputation, not sneaky tracking, is the critical advantage. At the same time you have to play the existing game where you can’t sell an ad unless you agree to infest your site with trackers that are data-leaking your user data to the junk sites you’re competing with.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: We might assume that the big gainers from online ad fraud are the criminals themselves. But according to the WFA, the group that gains the most is actually the legitimate marketing and advertising industry. The more skin an ad agency or agency holding company has in the ad tech money-flow chain (e.g., agency of record; trading desk; DSP; ad tech provider, etc) the greater is its potential for revenue derived indirectly from ad fraud. In fact, as far as agencies and other marketing entities are concerned, fraud seems to add to their revenue stream.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Ad fraud carries with it almost no risk. According to Hewlett-Packard Enterprises, ad fraud has a higher payout potential and lower risk factor than any other type of online crime.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: One of the most difficult problems for advertisers to come to terms with is the size of online ad fraud.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: According to the World Federation of Advertisers by 2025 ad fraud may be the second largest source of criminal income on the planet, after drug trafficking.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: we are never going to sell your data, except if we need to.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: modern data-analysis tools are capable of finding links between large databases

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: The illusion that we are in charge is masking the fact that the powerful are getting more powerful and that the individual citizen has less control than ever. You have to be mighty naive to believe that they have all the information but we are in charge.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: What that means is that Yahoo would not be able to scan our emails and text messages and use the information gleaned from doing so to create targeting opportunities for their advertising clients.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: It’s hard to overestimate the damage that ad tech has had on the credibility of our news media. The fact that we have a populace that no longer knows what to believe from a media industry they once trusted is not an accident.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: fake news is at least as attributable to easy ad tech money as it is to politics.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Below is an egregious example of a successful fake news story.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: This practice amounts to hijacking user identities and disguising them as product endorsements. The ad below appeared in my Facebook feed.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Let’s ignore for a second the unspeakable crap that Yahoo considers front page news. One of the leading stories on this front page is not a news story at all. It is an ad disguised as a news story

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: the overall look and feel of the ads is so similar to search results that according to independent research half of people can’t distinguish between an ad and a search result.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Google earns most of its money by subtle misdirection.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: The idea that the same person who was frantically clicking her tv remote to escape from advertising would gleefully click her mouse to interact with it is going to go down as one of the great marketing delusions of all time.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: have a look at this chart.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: everything the ad tech industry has ever told us about privacy and security has, in the fullness of time, turned out to be complete horseshit.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: An overall rate of effectiveness that is usually reported at about 6 clicks per 10,000 ads served. Solve Media says a person is more likely to complete Navy SEAL training than click on a banner ad.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: Ad tech is also the economic engine behind fake news. One of its most pernicious effects is the corruption of journalism.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: “brand safety” crisis marketers

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: by 2025 online ad fraud, enabled substantially by tracking, may become the second largest source of criminal income in the world

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: over 600 million web-connected devices are now armed with ad blockers. According to Doc Searls author of The Cluetrain Manifesto and The Intention Economy, this is the largest boycott of anything in the history of humanity.

BookTitle: BadMen: How Advertising Went From A Minor Annoyance To A Major Menace
Content: It is subverting our industry’s relationship with the public. It has enabled a cesspool of corruption and an ocean of fraud. It places personal and private information about us within the reach of criminals, governments, and other potential malefactors.
